author:

title: Belmont South Point moves into Observer’s Sweet 16 football rankings
text:
Belmont South Point moves into Observer’s Sweet 16 football rankings 
Observer rankings of the top 16 high school football programs in our circulation area 
Sweet 16 rankings are posted every Monday 
By Langston Wertz Jr. Order Reprint of this Story 
Belmont’s South Point High is back in the Observer’s Sweet 16 poll. 
The Red Raiders began the season with two losses in three weeks – to unbeatens Crest and Shelby. Since then, South Point has won five games in a row, including Friday’s 34-7 win at Forestview. 
▪ Charlotte Catholic is No. 1 for the second week. The Cougars, who fended off South Meck 10-7 on the road Friday, moved to No. 1 for the first time in school history last week. 
▪ Hough moved up to No. 3 after beating A.L. Brown 21-7 on the road. 
Observer Sweet 16
